questions.question: what is hyperax os
questions.answer: Hyperax OS is a custom Linux-based operating system project designed for speed and flexibility.

questions.question: what is zu os
questions.answer: ZU OS is another OS project aimed to run .exe and .apk files while being lightweight.

questions.question: who is yassin mohamed
questions.answer: Yassin Mohamed is the developer behind projects like ZU OS and Hyperax OS.

questions.question: how to run exe on linux
questions.answer: You can use tools like Wine or BoxedWine to run Windows .exe files on Linux.

questions.question: what is arduino
questions.answer: Arduino is an open-source electronics platform for building interactive hardware projects.

questions.question: what is esp32
questions.answer: ESP32 is a powerful microcontroller with Wi-Fi and Bluetooth, great for IoT projects.

questions.answer: GTA V is an open-world action-adventure game developed by Rockstar Games.

questions.answer: Forza is a series of realistic racing games with great graphics and cars.

questions.answer: Some popular choices include GTA V, Red Dead Redemption 2, and Forza Horizon 5.

questions.question: what is qemu
questions.answer: QEMU is an open-source emulator and virtualizer for running OS images.

questions.question: what is buildroot
questions.answer: Buildroot is a tool for creating custom Linux system images.

questions.answer: Practice small projects, follow tutorials, and build something you enjoy.

questions.question: how to center a div in css
questions.answer: Use `display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center;` on the parent.

questions.answer: JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight format for data exchange.

questions.answer: API stands for Application Programming Interface, a way for software to communicate.

questions.answer: Use `git add`, `git commit`, and `git push` with your repo’s remote URL.

questions.answer: RAM stands for Random Access Memory, used by computers for fast temporary storage.

questions.answer: CPU stands for Central Processing Unit, the main processor of a computer.

questions.answer: In Windows, right-click the USB drive in File Explorer and select Format.

questions.answer: Right-click the folder, choose ‘Send to’, then select ‘Compressed (zipped) folder’.

questions.answer: Open source means the software’s source code is publicly available to use and modify.

questions.answer: Create `app.py`, define your routes, then run `flask run`.
